channel.title: Tpot on Humans of TPOT
channel.description: Recent content in Tpot on Humans of TPOT

item.title: Humans of TPOT: Darpan
item.description: Been a long time folks, the ups and downs of running a 200 follower account got to us.

item.title: Humans of TPOT: Beeryani
item.description: We are the result of millions of years of evolution, and here we are, tweeting our lives away.

item.title: Humans of TPOT: Barbie
item.description: How are you, my dear friends? I am doing alright. Today, I met Toad-sama while I was coming back home from the shop.

item.title: Humans of TPOT: Aashutosh
item.description: Happy New Year frens. We had a good year overall. We featured cool people on our blog, went through some dry spells and lows, but we emerged strong.

item.title: Humans of TPOT: Cholesterol
item.description: The year’s end is near, and I’m feeling nostalgic. As I write this, my father is playing sad songs on the speaker, making it difficult to conjure anything remotely funny.

item.title: Humans of TPOT: Astronikos
item.description: Things have been a bit slow on my side. The stock market has been performing well for some days, but I see job losses around, so I am not sure about the state of the economy.

item.title: The Hotpot Crisis
item.description: Today we will tell you a story about how the greatest management tragedy took place on the platform called X.

item.title: Humans of TPOT: Jazzy
item.description: So we are accelerating! I have decided that I will track all the people I have sent links to on Google Sheets and put in reminder dates, and persistently follow up with them until they have filled out the questionnaireâ€”no sitting passively.

item.title: Humans of TPOT: Puru
item.description: Things have been a little slow here, not because of our Chief Editor’s subpar selling skills.

item.title: Humans of TPOT: Likitha ji
item.description: I have realised that when I sleep on time and enjoy undisturbed sleep, I wake up in a better mood.

item.title: Humans of TPOT: Niharika ji
item.description: I have no fun anecdotes to share today about my life.

item.title: Humans of TPOT: Vishwanath
item.description: My stress buster was to roam around the city in vice city in a car and follow traffic rules whilst doing that.

item.title: Humans of TPOT: Brian Brain
item.description: Yesterday, I was pondering how we arrived at this point in life.

item.title: Humans of TPOT: Deba and West Bengal Politics
item.description: You might have read the tweets where I mentioned that things have been slow here, slower than usual.

item.title: Humans of TPOT: Go Go Go Govind ji
item.description: I have been thinking about this a long time, what if we could do whatever we wanted without worrying about money.

item.title: Humans of TPOT: Jeff ji Amrica
item.description: I got up early today, because a mouse was making a ruckus and throwing things which were kept above the wardrobe.

item.title: Humans of TPOT: JSK Shri Hacker ji
item.description: All of you who are wondering what JSK stands for, it is, Jai Shri Krishna.

item.title: Humans of TPOT: log(Sam)
item.description: I have been thinking about starting to exercise, nothing extreme like going to the gym and pumping iron, just long walks, some cycling.

item.title: Humans of TPOT: Param Likes Computers
item.description: Listening to some songs make you nostalgic, some songs make you sad, some songs makes you happy, some songs make you want to pick up your keyboard smash it on table and then dance while you continue the destruction.

item.title: Humans of TPOT: Prge and his Army of egirls
item.description: Yesterday wasn’t such a good day, but today is better, and life seems worth living.

item.title: Humans of TPOT: Ranveer and his Accounts
item.description: Did I tell you about the huge frog? Oh, yes, I did.

item.title: Humans of TPOT: Samosa and his perils
item.description: Before I get to the guest for today, let me tell you about something I saw today, I saw a big frog today, like really big.

item.title: Humans of TPOT: The Almighty Telt
item.description: I think a polarised world will work in the benefit of human society because people will see how ridiculous the extreme opinions are and then people will start floating over the centre.

item.title: Humans of TPOT: The Art of Tokenbending
item.description: Today we are going to talk about a human who plays with LLMs (Large Language Models), TokenBender (e/xperiments) .

item.title: Humans of TPOT: The Rise of Cocainestudio
item.description: This story is not about me but Iâ€™ll tell this story as a first person so yâ€™all can suck it!

item.title: Humans of TPOT: Unraveling EDS
item.description: I have been on twitter/X for a while now, I know this story isnâ€™t about me, but I am the one writing it, innit?
